text: People change for two reasons Either their Minds have been Opened Or Their Hearts have been Broken
author: Navneet Shakya

text: Keep going everything comes to you at the Right Time
author: Navneet Shakya

text: Love in not between a Beautiful man and women. Love is between two beautiful Hearts
author: Navneet Shakya

text: Don't comment bad code. Rewrite It
author: Navneet Shakya

text: If you're not comfortable within yourself. You can't be comfortable with Others
author: Navneet Shakya

text: True friends look at you with no judgement in their eyes. They know you're made mistakes but they accept you for being human And help you right the wrongs
author: Navneet Shakya

text: If you light a lamp for somebody. It will also brighten your path
author: Navneet Shakya

text: Set your heart on doing good. Do it over and over again And you will be filled with joy..
author: Navneet Shakya

text: Making people smile is a way of increasing your own Positive Energy
author: Navneet Shakya

text: Anything that makes you weak physically, mentally and Spiritually. Reject it as Poison
author: Navneet Shakya

text: Every night I imagine someone to hold me until I fall asleep And every night I believe in it To ever Happen Less
author: Navneet Shakya

text: If your friends don't make fun of you. They are not really your friends..
author: Navneet Shakya

text: Do not dwell in the past, do not dream of the future, concentrate the mind on the present moment.
author: Buddha

text: The mind is everything. What you think you become.
author: Buddha

text: Peace comes from within. Do not seek it without.
author: Buddha

text: You will not be punished for your anger; you will be punished by your anger.
author: Buddha

text: It is better to conquer yourself than to win a thousand battles. Then the victory is yours. It cannot be taken from you.
author: Buddha

text: Three things cannot be long hidden: the sun, the moon, and the truth.
author: Buddha

text: To enjoy good health, to bring true happiness to one's family, to bring peace to all, one must first discipline and control one's own mind. If a man can control his mind he can find the way to Enlightenment, and all wisdom and virtue will naturally come to him.
author: Buddha

text: In the end, only three things matter: how much you loved, how gently you lived, and how gracefully you let go of things not meant for you.
author: Buddha

text: Believe nothing, no matter where you read it, or who said it, no matter if I have said it, unless it agrees with your own reason and your own common sense.
author: Buddha

text: Holding on to anger is like grasping a hot coal with the intent of throwing it at someone else; you are the one who gets burned.
author: Buddha

text: Thousands of candles can be lighted from a single candle, and the life of the candle will not be shortened. Happiness never decreases by being shared.
author: Buddha

text: Just as a snake sheds its skin, we must shed our past over and over again.
author: Buddha

text: The only real failure in life is not to be true to the best one knows.
author: Buddha

text: Better than a thousand hollow words, is one word that brings peace.
author: Buddha

text: Your work is to discover your world and then with all your heart give yourself to it.
author: Buddha

text: The secret of health for both mind and body is not to mourn for the past, worry about the future, or anticipate troubles, but to live in the present moment wisely and earnestly.
author: Buddha

text: An idea that is developed and put into action is more important than an idea that exists only as an idea.
author: Buddha

text: There is no path to happiness: happiness is the path.
author: Buddha

text: In the end these things matter most: How well did you love? How fully did you live? How deeply did you let go?
author: Buddha

text: To understand everything is to forgive everything.
author: Buddha

text: Conquer anger by love, evil by good; conquer the miser with liberality, and the liar with truth.
author: King Ashoka

text: I consider the welfare of all to be my duty, and I pledge to work for the happiness of all.
author: King Ashoka

text: One should not honor only one's own religion and condemn the religions of others, but one should honor others' religions for this or that reason.
author: King Ashoka

text: The greatest victory is the victory over oneself. None can subdue this inner enemy if one's own self is not conquered.
author: King Ashoka

text: Let all living beings live happily, let all live free from diseases, and let all see goodness and auspiciousness in everything.
author: King Ashoka

text: A generous heart, kind speech, and a life of service and compassion are the things that renew humanity.
author: King Ashoka

text: Tolerance is the highest form of strength. It brings people together and promotes harmony in society.
author: King Ashoka

text: Let your compassion be a source of joy for others and a reason for their relief. Work for the happiness and well-being of all.
author: King Ashoka

text: He who walks in the path of truth and righteousness walks in the path of peace and non-violence.
author: King Ashoka

text: The happiness of a person arises from the happiness of others. Seek the well-being of all, and you will find your own well-being.
author: King Ashoka

text: Let your thoughts be filled with the words of truth, kindness, and goodwill. Speak or act with a mind that is calm, compassionate, and understanding.
author: King Ashoka

text: The conquest by Dharma is the best conquest. It brings not harm to any living being but only good for all.
author: King Ashoka

text: Strive for inner purity and cultivate a heart full of love. This is the essence of a noble life.
author: King Ashoka

text: Do not be satisfied with small acts of kindness. Strive to make a significant impact on the well-being of others.
author: King Ashoka

text: The greatest service is to overcome one's own faults and work on the improvement of oneself.
author: King Ashoka

text: Let compassion be the guide of your actions, and you will find the path to true happiness.
author: King Ashoka

text: In the pursuit of justice and righteousness, one finds the true meaning of life.
author: King Ashoka

text: The strength of a ruler lies not in the might of the army but in the welfare and happiness of the people.
author: King Ashoka

text: A wise ruler listens to the needs and concerns of the people, fostering a kingdom of understanding and cooperation.
author: King Ashoka

text: Live in such a way that you leave a positive legacy for future generations. Let your actions echo in eternity.
author: King Ashoka

text: The greatest victory is to conquer oneself. True triumph lies in overcoming one's own weaknesses and attachments.
author: King Ashoka

text: Strive to be a source of inspiration and positive change in the lives of those around you. Your actions can create a ripple effect of goodness.
author: King Ashoka

text: Cultivate a spirit of forgiveness and understanding. Let go of grudges and embrace the healing power of compassion.
author: King Ashoka

text: The way to peace is through the practice of non-violence, compassion, and understanding. Be a beacon of these virtues in your life.
author: King Ashoka

text: Each moment is an opportunity for positive transformation. Embrace the present with mindfulness and a commitment to noble principles.
author: King Ashoka

text: Education is the key to unlock the golden door of freedom and empowerment for all.
author: Jyotiva rao Phule

text: Let the light of knowledge dispel the darkness of ignorance. Education is the birthright of every individual.
author: Jyotiva rao Phule

text: Challenge the oppressive traditions and strive for social justice. Break the chains of discrimination through education and awareness.
author: Jyotiva rao Phule

text: Empower women through education, for when a woman is educated, an entire family, and eventually, the nation, is empowered.
author: Jyotiva rao Phule

text: Seek knowledge not for the sake of wealth or power, but for the liberation of the mind and the upliftment of society.
author: Jyotiva rao Phule

text: Stand against the prevailing social injustices. Be the voice for the voiceless, and the champion of the oppressed.
author: Jyotiva rao Phule

text: Education is not a privilege but a tool for the transformation of society. Let it be accessible to all, regardless of caste or gender.
author: Jyotiva rao Phule

text: Challenge the prejudices ingrained in society. Let knowledge be the force that dismantles the walls of discrimination.
author: Jyotiva rao Phule

text: Cultivate a sense of social responsibility. Strive for the welfare of all, and work towards the upliftment of the marginalized.
author: Jyotiva rao Phule

text: Let education be a tool for the eradication of ignorance, poverty, and inequality. Empower individuals to shape a just and equitable society.
author: Jyotiva rao Phulee

text: Break the chains of superstition and orthodoxy. Embrace rational thinking and scientific inquiry.
author: Jyotiva rao Phule

text: The true measure of progress is not wealth or power but the well-being and upliftment of the most vulnerable in society.
author: Jyotiva rao Phule

text: Let compassion guide your actions. Stand with the marginalized and work towards creating a just and inclusive society.
author: Jyotiva rao Phule

text: Educate not just the mind but also the heart. Foster empathy and kindness through the power of education.
author: Jyotiva rao Phule

text: Strive for equality in all aspects of life. Reject discrimination based on caste, creed, or gender.
author: Jyotiva rao Phule

text: Education is the foundation of democracy. Nurture an informed citizenry for the strength and prosperity of the nation.
author: Jyotiva rao Phule

text: Challenge the status quo. Let education be the instrument of social transformation and a catalyst for positive change.
author: Jyotiva rao Phule

text: Empower the downtrodden through education. Elevate the oppressed to become architects of their own destiny.
author: Jyotiva rao Phule

text: In the pursuit of knowledge, there is no room for discrimination. Let education be a force that unites rather than divides.
author: Jyotiva rao Phule

text: Foster a culture of inclusivity. Let education be the bridge that connects people from diverse backgrounds.
author: Jyotiva rao Phule

text: Teach the values of justice, equality, and fraternity. Let every individual contribute to the betterment of society.
author: Jyotiva rao Phule

text: Knowledge is the antidote to oppression. Empower the masses with education, and they will liberate themselves.
author: Jyotiva rao Phule

text: Challenge ignorance with the light of education. Let every mind be a torchbearer of enlightenment.
author: Jyotiva rao Phule

text: Strive for a society where every child has access to quality education, irrespective of their social or economic background.
author: Jyotiva rao Phule

text: The journey of education is a collective one. Let communities come together to uplift each other through the power of learning.
author: Jyotiva rao Phule

text: Education is the key to liberate the mind and empower women. Let it be a beacon of light for all.
author: Savitribai Phule

text: Challenge societal norms that restrict the rights of women. Stand for equality and justice for all.
author: Savitribai Phule

text: Let every girl child have the opportunity to learn and grow. Education is her birthright.
author: Savitribai Phule

text: The pen is mightier than the sword. Empower women with knowledge and watch them transform society.
author: Savitribai Phule

text: Strive for a society where women are not just educated but are active contributors to the progress of the nation.
author: Savitribai Phule

text: Education is not just about textbooks; it is about empowering individuals to think critically and question the status quo.
author: Savitribai Phule

text: Embrace the power of education to break the shackles of ignorance and discrimination against women.
author: Savitribai Phule

text: Let the classroom be a space where minds are nurtured and dreams are kindled, irrespective of gender.
author: Savitribai Phule

text: Challenge the stereotypes that confine women. Education is the tool to redefine their roles and possibilities.
author: Savitribai Phule

text: A literate woman is an empowered woman. Educate, uplift, and empower the women of our society.
author: Savitribai Phule

text: Teach not just facts but values. Foster a sense of justice, compassion, and equality in the hearts of the learners.
author: Savitribai Phule

text: The journey of education is a journey towards self-discovery. Let every girl find her voice and her potential.
author: Savitribai Phule

text: In the pursuit of knowledge, let there be no gender barriers. Education is the birthright of every individual.
author: Savitribai Phule

text: Empower women with education, and they will empower the world with their wisdom and strength.
author: Savitribai Phule

text: Foster an environment where girls are encouraged to dream big and believe in their own capabilities.
author: Savitribai Phule

text: Let education be the vehicle that transports women from the margins of society to the forefront of progress.
author: Savitribai Phule

text: Challenge ignorance with the light of education. It is the most potent weapon to combat inequality.
author: Savitribai Phule

text: Education is not just about acquiring knowledge; it is about using that knowledge to bring positive change.
author: Savitribai Phule

text: Strive for a society where the worth of a woman is not judged by her circumstances but by her abilities and aspirations.
author: Savitribai Phule

text: Let education be the bridge that connects women with their rights, opportunities, and dreams.
author: Savitribai Phule

text: Encourage the spirit of inquiry and curiosity in every girl. Let her thirst for knowledge be unquenchable.
author: Savitribai Phule

text: Break the chains of illiteracy that bind women. Education is the key to their emancipation.
author: Savitribai Phule

text: In the classroom, let there be no discrimination. Every girl deserves the chance to learn, grow, and shine.
author: Savitribai Phule

text: Education is the seed; empowerment is the flower. Let every girl blossom into a force for positive change.
author: Savitribai Phule

text: Challenge the biases ingrained in society. Let education be the force that dismantles the walls of gender-based discrimination.
author: Savitribai Phule

text: Educate a woman, and you educate a generation. The impact of empowering women with knowledge is far-reaching.
author: Savitribai Phule

text: Strive for a world where every woman, regardless of her background, has the opportunity to become the best version of herself.
author: Savitribai Phule

text: Education is the cornerstone of progress. Let it be the foundation upon which women build their aspirations and achievements.
author: Savitribai Phule

text: Empower women with the tools of knowledge, and watch them transform adversity into opportunities for themselves and others.
author: Savitribai Phule

text: A revolution is not worth anything unless it can defend itself.
author: Bhagat Singh

text: It is easy to kill individuals but you cannot kill the ideas. Great empires crumbled, while the ideas survived.
author: Bhagat Singh

text: The spirit of revolution should always permeate the soul of humanity, so that the reactionary forces may not accumulate to check its eternal onward march.
author: Bhagat Singh

text: They may kill me, but they cannot kill my ideas. They can crush my body, but they will not be able to crush my spirit.
author: Bhagat Singh

text: The sword of revolution is sharpened on the whetting-stone of ideas.
author: Bhagat Singh

text: Merciless criticism and independent thinking are the two necessary traits of revolutionary thinking.
author: Bhagat Singh

text: The sanctity of law can be maintained only so long as it is the expression of the will of the people.
author: Bhagat Singh

text: I am a man and all that affects mankind concerns me.
author: Bhagat Singh

text: Revolution is an inalienable right of mankind. Freedom is an imperishable birthright of all.
author: Bhagat Singh

text: By crushing individuals, they cannot kill ideas.
author: Bhagat Singh

text: I will not let my countrymen's heads bow down in shame. I will fight until my last breath for a free India.
author: Chandra Shekhar Azad

text: Freedom is not given, it is taken. We must earn it through our courage and sacrifice.
author: Chandra Shekhar Azad

text: True revolutionaries do not seek personal glory; they work selflessly for the greater good of the nation.
author: Chandra Shekhar Azad

text: The spark of revolution ignites in the hearts of those who refuse to live in chains. I am that spark.
author: Chandra Shekhar Azad

text: The struggle for independence is not just about overthrowing foreign rule but also about creating a just and equal society.
author: Chandra Shekhar Azad

text: Our fight is not against a nation but against the unjust and oppressive systems that keep our people enslaved.
author: Chandra Shekhar Azad

text: Fear is the enemy of freedom. Only those who fear nothing can truly be free.
author: Chandra Shekhar Azad

text: Every drop of my blood will contribute to the growth of this nation and to make it strong and dynamic.
author: Chandra Shekhar Azad

text: A true revolutionary is guided by great feelings of love. Love for humanity, love for justice, and love for freedom.
author: Chandra Shekhar Azad

text: It is better to die on your feet than to live on your knees. I choose freedom over servitude.
author: Chandra Shekhar Azad

text: The call of duty is louder than the call of personal comfort. I am committed to the cause of a free India.
author: Chandra Shekhar Azad

text: Let my country awake. Let every citizen contribute their best for the progress and prosperity of our motherland.
author: Chandra Shekhar Azad

text: To liberate the country, one must first liberate the minds of the people from the shackles of ignorance.
author: Chandra Shekhar Azad

text: Courage is the first and foremost quality of a revolutionary. It is the strength that fuels the fight for freedom.
author: Chandra Shekhar Azad

text: The sacrifice of one's life is a small price to pay for the liberty and dignity of a nation.
author: Chandra Shekhar Azad

text: I do not want to live as a slave. I am ready to face the consequences of my actions for the sake of a free India.
author: Chandra Shekhar Azad

text: Our struggle is not against individuals; it is against the oppressive system that denies our people their rights.
author: Chandra Shekhar Azad

text: The flame of freedom must never be extinguished. It must burn bright in the hearts of every patriot.
author: Chandra Shekhar Azad

text: I am free, and I want my freedom. And I shall have it at any cost.
author: Chandra Shekhar Azad

text: The struggle for freedom is not a one-time event; it is a continuous process that requires constant vigilance and dedication.
author: Chandra Shekhar Azad
